Constructs a new distribution object. 

@1@ Default constructor. Constructs the distribution with a single weight {{math|p {{=}} {1}}}. This distribution will always generate {{c|0}}.

@2@ Constructs the distribution with weights in the range {{range|first|last}}. If {{c|first {{==}} last}}, the effects are the same as of the default constructor.

@3@ Constructs the distribution with weights in {{c|weights}}. Effectively calls {{c|discrete_distribution(weights.begin(), weights.end())}}.

@4@ Constructs the distribution with {{c|count}} weights that are generated using function {{c|unary_op}}. Each of the weights is equal to {{math|w{{su|b=i}} {{=}} unary_op(xmin + δ(i + 0.5))}}, where {{math|δ {{=}} {{mfrac|(xmax − xmin)|count}}}} and {{math|i ∈ {0, ..., count − 1}}}. {{c|xmin}} and {{c|xmax}} must be such that {{math|δ &gt; 0}}. If {{c|count {{==}} 0}} the effects are the same as of the default constructor.

@5@ Constructs the distribution with {{c|params}} as the distribution parameters.

{{par begin}}
{{par|first, last|the range of elements defining the numbers to use as weights. The type of the elements referred by {{tt|InputIterator}} must be convertible to {{c|double}}}}
{{par|weights|initializer list containing the weights}}
{{par op1|unary_op|rp=double|p1=double}}
{{par|params|the distribution parameter set}}
{{par hreq}}
{{par req named|InputIt|InputIterator}}
{{par end}}
